workflow.name: Automate school trip consent forms with email verification, PDF generation & Google Drive
workflow.description:
## Verified Parent Consent Form Automation for School Trips

---

## üéØ **Description**

This workflow automates the **entire parent consent process for school field trips**, replacing manual paper forms with a secure, verified, and legally compliant digital system.

When a parent submits consent data via **POST request (from Postman or any form)**, the workflow:

1. **Receives parent & trip details** through a Webhook trigger.
2. **Verifies the parent‚Äôs email** using the **VerifiEmail API** to prevent fake or disposable entries.
3. **Generates a unique Consent ID** and timestamps for tracking and legal validation.
4. **Creates a professional HTML-based digital consent form**, including child details, trip information, and a parent signature section.
5. **Converts the HTML document to a PDF** using the **HTMLCSSToPDF API** (ready for printing or archiving).
6. **Uploads the PDF to Google Drive** automatically, organizing it under a designated folder (e.g., `/School_Consents/2025/November`).
7. **Sends an automated Gmail notification** to the respective class teacher, including all verified details and the Drive reference.
8. **Responds instantly** to the original POST request with a success confirmation and all metadata (Consent ID, verification status, storage location, timestamp).
9. **Handles invalid emails gracefully**, returning a 400 error response for unauthorized or unverified submissions.
10. **Provides complete traceability**, digital audit, and tamper-proof documentation for school compliance.

**Use Case:**
Ideal for schools, institutions, or organizations that need **paperless consent workflows** with **email verification**, **cloud storage**, and **automated staff alerts** ‚Äî ensuring authenticity, security, and compliance.

---

## üß© **Features**

* Email verification (VerifiEmail)
* Auto-generated unique Consent ID
* HTML-to-PDF conversion (HTMLCSSToPDF)
* Google Drive cloud storage integration
* Automated Gmail teacher notification
* API-friendly POST-based trigger
* Real-time error handling & response
* Legally formatted consent slip

---
                                                                                     

## üß™ **Test Input Example (Postman)**

Use this JSON in Postman when testing the webhook:

```json
{
  "parent_name": "Ritu Sharma",
  "parent_email": "ritu.sharma@gmail.com",
  "child_name": "Aarav Sharma",
  "child_class": "Grade 5-A",
  "trip_name": "Science Museum Visit",
  "trip_date": "2025-11-10",
  "teacher_email": "teacher@school.edu"
}
```

---

## ‚úÖ **Expected Output**

**Success Response (200):**

```json
{
  "status": "success",
  "message": "Parent consent form verified and stored successfully",
  "data": {
    "consent_id": "CONSENT-1699123456789",
    "child_name": "Aarav Sharma",
    "trip_name": "Science Museum Visit",
    "email_verified": true,
    "stored_at": "Google Drive",
    "teacher_notified": true
  }
}
```

**Error Response (400):**

```json
{
  "status": "error",
  "message": "Invalid email address provided. Please use a valid email.",
  "reason": "Email verification failed"
}
```

---

## üåê **Workflow Tags for n8n Creators**

`#Education #Automation #EmailVerification #PDFGeneration #GoogleDrive #Webhook #SchoolAdmin #PaperlessWorkflow #Compliance`

---

parameters.content:
## üéØ WORKFLOW START

**Purpose:** Automated Parent Consent System for School Trips

**Trigger:** POST request from Postman or any form

**Expected Input:**
- parent_name
- parent_email
- child_name
- child_class
- trip_name
- trip_date
- teacher_email

## üîë SETUP CREDENTIALS

**Required Accounts & API Keys:**

1. **VerifiEmail**
   - Sign up: https://verifi.email
   - Get API key from dashboard

2. **Google Account (Drive + Gmail)**
   - Use OAuth2 authentication

3. **HTMLCSSToPDF**
   - Sign up: https://pdfmunk.com
   - Get API key

## üì• STEP 1: Webhook Trigger

**What it does:**
- Receives POST request with parent consent data
- Captures all form fields

```json
{
  "parent_name": "Ritu Sharma",
  "parent_email": "ritu.sharma@gmail.com",
  "child_name": "Aarav Sharma",
  "child_class": "Grade 5-A",
  "trip_name": "Science Museum Visit",
  "trip_date": "2025-11-10",
  "teacher_email": "teacher@school.edu"
}
```

## üìß STEP 2: Email Verification

**What it does:**
- Validates parent email is real
- Checks for disposable/temporary emails
- Prevents fraud and fake submissions

## ‚úÖ STEP 3: Validation Check

**What it does:**
- Checks if email valid = 'true'
- Creates two paths: TRUE or FALSE

**TRUE path:** Continue workflow
**FALSE path:** Send error response & stop

## ‚ùå ERROR HANDLER

**Triggers when:** Email is invalid

**Action:**
- Send 400 error response
- Include error message
- Stop workflow execution

**Response sent to user:**
- Status: error
- Message: Invalid email
- Reason: Verification failed

## üî¢ STEP 4: Generate Unique ID

**What it does:**
- Creates unique consent ID using timestamp
- Format: CONSENT-1699123456789
- Adds generation timestamp (ISO format)
- Adds formatted date for display

**Why important:**
- Tracks each consent uniquely
- Prevents duplicates
- Legal reference number
- Audit trail

## üìë STEP 5: Convert to PDF

**What it does:**
- Converts HTML to PDF document
- A4 format with margins
- Print-ready quality
- Legal document format

## ‚òÅÔ∏è STEP 7: Upload to Google Drive

**Folder structure:**
/School_Consents
  ‚îî‚îÄ 2025
      ‚îî‚îÄ November
          ‚îî‚îÄ {files}

**File naming:**
{ChildName}_{ConsentID}.pdf

parameters.subject: =New Consent Received: {{ $('Webhook Trigger').item.json.body.child_name }} - {{ $('Webhook Trigger').item.json.body.trip_name }}

parameters.content:
## üìß STEP 8: Notify Teacher

**What it does:**
- Sends email to class teacher
- Includes all consent details
- Provides Drive link reference
- Confirmation of verification

**Sent to:** teacher_email (from webhook)
**From:** Your Gmail account

parameters.responseBody:
={
  "status": "success",
  "message": "Parent consent form verified and stored successfully",
  "data": {
    "consent_id": "{{ $json.consent_id }}",
    "child_name": "{{ $json.child_name }}",
    "child_class": "{{ $json.child_class }}",
    "trip_name": "{{ $json.trip_name }}",
    "trip_date": "{{ $json.trip_date }}",
    "parent_name": "{{ $json.parent_name }}",
    "parent_email": "{{ $json.parent_email }}",
    "email_verified": true,
    "stored_at": "Google Drive",
    "teacher_notified": true,
    "generated_at": "{{ $json.generated_at }}"
  }
}

parameters.content:
## ‚úÖ STEP 9: Send Success Response

**Response includes:**
- Status: success
- Consent ID
- All submission data
- Verification status
- Storage confirmation
- Teacher notification status

## Download the PDF 
**What it does**:

- GETs the PDF file through URL

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
